http://www.singaporeflyer.com The Singapore Flyer is a giant Ferris wheel in Singapore. Described by its operators as an observation wheel, it opened in 2008, construction having taken about 2Â½ years. 8:30AM to 10:30PM https://www.tripadvisor.com.sg/Attraction_Review-g294265-d678639-Reviews-Singapore_Flyer-Singapore.html " http://www.vivocity.com.sg "VivoCity is the largest shopping mall in Singapore. Located in the HarbourFront precinct of Bukit Merah, it was designed by the Japanese architect Toyo Ito. Its name is derived from the word vivacity." 10AM to 10PM https://www.tripadvisor.com.sg/Attraction_Review-g294265-d634131-Reviews-Vivo_City-Singapore.html
http://www.rwsentosa.com Resorts World Sentosa is Singapore\'s integrated resort, offering key attractions including theme parks, hotels, spa, casino, and meeting and incentive venues. Varies depending on establishment https://www.tripadvisor.com.sg/Tourism-g294264-Sentosa_Island-Vacations.html
http://www.btrts.org.sg The Buddha Tooth Relic Temple and Museum is a Buddhist temple and museum complex located in the Chinatown district of Singapore. 7AM to 7PM https://www.tripadvisor.com.my/Attraction_Review-g294265-d1438273-Reviews-Buddha_Tooth_Relic_Temple_and_Museum-Singapore.html
http://www.zoo.com.sg The Singapore Zoo, formerly known as the Singapore Zoological Gardens and commonly known locally as the Mandai Zoo, occupies 28 hectares on the margins of Upper Seletar Reservoir within Singapore\'s heavily forested central catchment area. 8:30AM to 6PM https://www.tripadvisor.com.my/Attraction_Review-g294265-d324542-Reviews-Singapore_Zoo-Singapore.html Map SearchPaths MyPaths Map
